com.versant.fund
Interface HandleEnumeration

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Enumeration
public interface HandleEnumeration
extends java.util.Enumeration

Interface HandleEnumeration extends java.util.Enumeration and used only when all the elements are of type Handle. It is used for the result of a select where the HandleEnumeration has the provision to read batches of objects.

Method Summary
 Handle[] asArray()
          Returns an array if no handle has yet been enumerated.
 boolean hasMoreHandles()
          Returns true if there are more handles in the enumeration or if more handles can be fetched from the cursor and otherwise returns false.
 void invalidateCursor()
          Invalidates a database cursor obtained by cursorSelect().
 HandleVector nextBatch()
          Returns the next cursor batch to a HandleVector using the default batch size (100).
 HandleVector nextBatch(int newBatchSize)
          Returns the next cursor batch to a HandleVector using the specified batch size.
 Handle nextHandle()
          Returns the next handle in the enumeration.
 
Methods inherited from interface java.util.Enumeration
hasMoreElements, nextElement
 

Method Detail

hasMoreHandles

boolean hasMoreHandles()
Returns true if there are more handles in the enumeration or if more handles can be fetched from the cursor and otherwise returns false.

This method is the same as hasMoreElements().

See Also:
HandleVector.asHandleEnumeration(), Enumeration.hasMoreElements(), HandleEnumeration.nextHandle(), Enumeration.nextElement(), HandleEnumeration.nextBatch(), HandleEnumeration.asArray()

nextHandle

Handle nextHandle()
Returns the next handle in the enumeration.

If there are no more handles in the enumeration, fetches the next cursor batch and returns the first handle from the batch.

This method is the same as nextElement().

throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if there are no more Handles in the Enumeration to iterate over.

See Also:
HandleVector.asHandleEnumeration(), HandleEnumeration.hasMoreHandles(), Enumeration.hasMoreElements(), Enumeration.nextElement(), HandleEnumeration.nextBatch(), HandleEnumeration.asArray()

asArray

Handle[] asArray()
Returns an array if no handle has yet been enumerated.

See Also:
HandleVector.asHandleEnumeration(), HandleEnumeration.hasMoreHandles(), Enumeration.hasMoreElements(), HandleEnumeration.nextHandle(), Enumeration.nextElement(), HandleEnumeration.nextBatch()

nextBatch

HandleVector nextBatch()
Returns the next cursor batch to a HandleVector using the default batch size (100).

If the receiver HandleEnumeration is created by select(), nextBatch() simply advances the current position of the enumeration by the batch size. Throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, when no more Handles in the enumeration.

If the receiver is created by cursorSelect(), the next cursor batch of object handles are fetched and returned, and advances the current position of the enumeration by the given batch size. Throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, when no more batch of object Handles can be fetched from the cursor.

Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no more Handles in the enumeration or no more batch of object Handles can be fetched from the cursor to iterate over.

nextBatch

HandleVector nextBatch(int newBatchSize)
Returns the next cursor batch to a HandleVector using the specified batch size.

If the receiver HandleEnumeration is created by select(), nextBatch() simply advances the current position of the enumeration by the batch size. Throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, when no more Handles in the enumeration.

If the receiver is created by cursorSelect(), the next cursor batch of object handles is fetched and returned. This advances the current position of the enumeration by the given batch size. The maximum number of objects that can be fetched in a batch is 65536. Throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, when no more Handles can be fetched from the cursor.

Parameters:
newBatchSize - The size of the next batch.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no more Handles in the enumeration or no more batch of object Handles can be fetched from the cursor to iterate over.
See Also:
HandleVector.asHandleEnumeration(), HandleEnumeration.hasMoreHandles(), Enumeration.hasMoreElements(), HandleEnumeration.nextHandle(), Enumeration.nextElement(), HandleEnumeration.asArray()

invalidateCursor

void invalidateCursor()
Invalidates a database cursor obtained by cursorSelect().

Once invalidated, no more fetches can be performed on the cursor.
